add_legitimacy.description: add_legitimacy = 10. Adds legitimacy to scope country. Value has to be 0-100.

add_stability.description: Adds the stability to the country in scope. Example: add_stability = 5

add_manpower.description: Adds manpower to the country in scope or locally on a state if in state scope

remove_building.description: Removes specified building in specified state or province

release.description: releases specified country as a puppet

every_country.description: Executes children effects on every country that fulfills the "limit" trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override tooltip title.

random_country.description: Executes children effects on random country that fulfills the "limit" trigger.

every_neighbor_country.description: Executes children effects on every neighbor country that fulfills the "limit" trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override tooltip title

random_neighbor_country.description: Executes children effects on random neighbor country that fulfills the "limit" trigger.

every_enemy_country.description: Executes children effects on random enemy country that fulfills the "limit" trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override tooltip title

random_enemy_country.description: Executes children effects on random enemy country that fulfills the "limit" trigger.

country_event.description:
Fires a country event.
Example:
country_event = {
	id = germany.75 # The event to fire.
	# Optional Fields:
	hours = 12 # The number of hours to wait before firing the event.
	days = 5 # The number of days to wait before firing the event.
	months = 1 # The number of months to wait before firing the event, where a month is treated as 30 days.
	# Note:  hours, days, and months can all be used and will simply be added together.
	random_hours = 18 # A random amount of hours to be added to the delay before firing, from 0 up to but not including random_hours.
	random_days = 2 # A random amount of days to be added to the delay before firing, from 0 up to but one hour less than random_days.
	# Note:  random_hours and random_days can both be used and will simply be added together.
	random = 6 # Equivalent to random_hours; preserverd for backwards compatibility.
	random = { chance = 50 ... } # Specify a set of child effects to execute as part of this effect, with a percentage chance of randomly happening or not (as a group, not individually).
	tooltip = germany.75.t # Manually specify which tooltip to use for this effect.
}

state_event.description:
Fires a state event.
Example:
state_event = {
	id = usa.61 # The event to fire.
	# Optional Fields:
	hours = 12 # The number of hours to wait before firing the event.
	days = 5 # The number of days to wait before firing the event.
	months = 1 # The number of months to wait before firing the event, where a month is treated as 30 days.
		# Note:  hours, days, and months can all be used and will simply be added together.
	random_hours = 18 # A random amount of hours to be added to the delay before firing, from 0 up to but not including random_hours.
	random_days = 2 # A random amount of days to be added to the delay before firing, from 0 up to but one hour less than random_days.
		# Note:  random_hours and random_days can both be used and will simply be added together.
	random = 6 # Equivalent to random_hours; preserverd for backwards compatibility.
	random = { chance = 50 ... } # Specify a set of child effects to execute as part of this effect, with a percentage chance of randomly happening or not (as a group, not individually).
	tooltip = usa.61.t # Manually specify which tooltip to use for this effect.
	trigger_for = GER # Indicate which country this state effect applies to. Value can be any of the following:
		# controller - The country that currently controls the state.
		# owner - The country that currently owns the state.
		# occupied - The country that has been occupied in the state by the current controller.
		# from - The country of the from scope.
		# prev - The country of the prev scope.
		# root - The country of the root scope.
		# TAG - A hard-coded country tag such as GER or ENG.
}

add_ai_strategy.description: Adds strategy entry to country AI

white_peace.description: white peaces the two countries if at war

log.description: Print message to game.log, console (if visible) and history logger (if running. you can use category|log to specify a category), Can be localized

create_unit.description:
Create unit effect, just like in OOB, example: 
create_unit = { 
	# unit detauls 
	division = "name = \"1. Northern Redemption Army\" division_template = \"Redemption Army\" start_experience_factor = 0.5" 
	# country to spawn unit for 
	owner = MAN 
	 
	 
	# a prov id can be specified 
	prioritize_location = 12406 
	 
	# can be set to yes to be able to spawn units on enemy provs. 
	allow_spawning_on_enemy_provs = no 
	# province controllers can be scored using this scorer. otherwise it will prio your owned provs first, friendly provs second.  
	# it will also prio provs with scores and less units firstl 
	country_score = { 
		base = 100 
		 
		modifier = { 
			tag = MAN 
			add = 100 
		} 
	} 
   count = 1 # can be specified to spawn more than one units 
   id = 42 # an id can be given to delete units later on}

division_template.description: add a division template to country

set_country_leader_ideology.description: change the ideology of active leader

add_country_leader_trait.description: add trait to active country leader

remove_country_leader_trait.description: remove trait from active country leader

set_technology.description:
sets technology level(s) on country. example : set_technology = { 
	infantry_weapons = 1 
	infantry_weapons1 = 1 
	infantry_weapons2 = 1 
	improved_infantry_weapons = 1 
	popup = no # default is yes. if set to no, no pop up will display for player 
}

gain_xp.description:
Grant experience to the scoped in unit leader. Cannot be used to remove experience.
The unit leader is promoted to the next skill level if applicable.
Example:
gain_xp = 5

delete_unit.description:
delete units of a country. no tooltip is generated. example: 

Example:
delete_unit = { 
	template = template_name # can be filtered a specific template 
	id = 42 # can be filtered to a given id in create unit effect 
	state = 64 # can be filtered by a given state 
	disband = yes # default is no. if set to yes the game will refund equipment/manpower
}

transfer_state.description: set owner and controller for state

add_building_construction.description: Starts building construction for amount of levels in specified state or province

dismantle_faction.description: dismantle faction led by the current country

give_military_access.description: gives military access to the specified country

random_state.description:
Executes children effects on a random state that fulfills the "limit" trigger.
State ids can be specified with the "prioritize" attribute and they will be
picked first if they fulfill the trigger.

random_owned_state.description:
Executes children effects on random owned state that fulfills the "limit" trigger. 
prioritize = { <stateID> <stateID> } to pick those states first if they fulfull the limit

random_neighbor_state.description: Executes children effects on random neighbor state that fulfills the "limit" trigger.

every_state.description: Executes children effects on every state that fulfills the "limit" trigger. tooltip=key can be added to override tooltip title

every_owned_state.description: Executes children effects on every owned state that fulfills the "limit" trigger. tooltip=key can be added to override tooltip title

every_neighbor_state.description: Executes children effects on every neighbor state that fulfills the "limit" trigger. tooltip=key can be added to override tooltip title

news_event.description:
Fires a news event.
Example:
news_event = {
	id = news.251 # The event to fire.
	# Optional Fields:
	hours = 12 # The number of hours to wait before firing the event.
	days = 5 # The number of days to wait before firing the event.
	months = 1 # The number of months to wait before firing the event, where a month is treated as 30 days.
		# Note:  hours, days, and months can all be used and will simply be added together.
	random_hours = 18 # A random amount of hours to be added to the delay before firing, from 0 up to but not including random_hours.
	random_days = 2 # A random amount of days to be added to the delay before firing, from 0 up to but one hour less than random_days.
		# Note:  random_hours and random_days can both be used and will simply be added together.
	random = 6 # Equivalent to random_hours; preserverd for backwards compatibility.
	random = { chance = 50 ... } # Specify a set of child effects to execute as part of this effect, with a percentage chance of randomly happening or not (as a group, not individually).
	tooltip = news.251.t # Manually specify which tooltip to use for this effect.
}

add_scaled_political_power.description: add political power to country scaled by the difference in IC between the receiver and another country

hold_election.description: Immediately holds an election in the target country

remove_ideas_with_trait.description: Remove all ideas with specified trait from country

start_civil_war.description:
Given ideology starts a civil war in the country.
start_civil_war = {
	ideology = revolting ideology
	ruling party = ruling party for country
	size = 0-1 Size modifier of the revolt. Affects stockpile, army, air and navy as well
	army_ratio = 0-1 Overrides size modifier for army
	navy_ratio = 0-1 Overrides size modifier for navy
	air_ratio = 0-1 Overrides size modifier for air
	keep_unit_leaders specify ID of unit leaders that remain with the original country
	keep_unit_leaders_trigger Trigger for unit leaders to remain with the original country
	states States that go to the revolter. Use "all" to include all states.
	states_filter States that go to the revolter. Filtering trigger on the states scripted to go to the revolter.
}

retire_country_leader.description: retires a country leader and removes him as leader of his party, making the next in line the new party and country leader

kill_country_leader.description: kills a country leader and removes him completely, making the next in line the new party and country leader

create_wargoal.description: creates wargoal for country in scope

add_core_of.description: Add state as core of country

remove_core_of.description: Removes state as core of country

unlock_national_focus.description: unlocks a focus for a country

add_tech_bonus.description: adds a limited use tech bonus

set_demilitarized_zone.description: adds a limited use tech bonus

add_research_slot.description: Adds a research slot (negative values subtracts)

set_research_slots.description: Sets the number of research slots

set_border_war.description: starts a border war in a state with neighbouring state that also has border war

send_equipment.description: Sends to target scope specified amount of equipment.

diplomatic_relation.description: Set up a diplomatic relation between two nations

add_timed_idea.description: add time limited idea to country idea, add_timed_idea = { idea = id days = number_of_days }

end_puppet.description: Stops specefied country being a puppet of current country

load_oob.description:
Immediately loads an Order of Battle (OOB) file.

Example:
load_oob = "ENG_1936"

complete_national_focus.description: unlocks a focus for a country

set_party_name.description: change partyname for an ideology in a country

add_extra_state_shared_building_slots.description: add extra shared building slot to state

add_to_war.description: adds country to the specified war

create_equipment_variant.description:
Creates a new equipment variant.
Example:
create_equipment_variant = {
	name = "Yorktown Class"
	type = ship_hull_carrier_2
	parent_version = 1  #default = 0
	obsolete = yes      #default = no
	name_group = ship_name_group_name      #default = empty/none
	role_icon_index = 3      #default just inherits from parent or remains unset
	role_icon_index = 0      #alternative, explicitly unset
	role_icon_index = auto   #uses AI design logic to pick
	upgrades = {        #optional, inherits from parent
		ship_deckspace_upgrade = 1
		carrier_armor_upgrade = 2
	}
	modules = {         #optional, inherits from parent
		fixed_ship_deck_slot_1 = ship_deck_space
		front_1_custom_slot = ship_armor_carrier_deck
		fixed_ship_deck_slot_2 = empty #overrides parent
	}
}

random_owned_controlled_state.description:
Executes children effects on random owned and controlled state that fulfills the "limit" trigger.
prioritize = { <stateID> <stateID> } to pick those states first if they fulfull the limit

every_other_country.description: Executes children effects on every other country that fulfills the "limit" trigger. Excludes current country. tooltip=key can be defined to override tooltip title

random_other_country.description: Executes children effects on random country that fulfills the "limit" trigger. Excludes current country

add_equipment_to_stockpile.description:
Adds equipment to the countries stockpiles. Amount can be a variable. 
Example: add_equipment_to_stockpile = { type = strat_bomber_equipment_2 amount = 100 producer = USA }

swap_ideas.description:
swap 2 ideas. 
 Syntax: swap_idea = {
  remove_idea = <idea>
  add_idea = <idea>
  add_days = 10 #optional, will add/subtract duration for new idea that replaces the old one with duration
  days = 25 #optional, will set the duration for the new idea
}

set_autonomy.description:
makes autonomy of specified level and country.
Example:
set_autonomy = {
target=ENG
autonomy_state = nautonomy_puppet
freedom_level=0.5
}

add_to_tech_sharing_group.description:
Adds country to technology sharing group of specified name.
Example: add_to_tech_sharing_group = commonwealth_research

remove_from_tech_sharing_group.description:
Removes country from technology sharing group of specified name.
Example: remove_from_tech_sharing_group = commonwealth_research

modify_tech_sharing_bonus.description:
Modify country bonus for specified technology sharing group.
Example: modify_tech_sharing_bonus  = { id = commonwealth_research bonus = 0.2 }

set_cosmetic_tag.description:
Sets country cosmetic tag.
Example: INS = { set_cosmetic_tag = IN1 }

drop_cosmetic_tag.description:
Drops country cosmetic tag.
Example: INS = { drop_cosmetic_tag }

set_state_category.description:
Sets the category of a state
Example: set_state_category = large_town

modify_global_flag.description:
modify global flag. Only modifies if flag already exists.
Example: modify_global_flag = { flag = <name> value = <number> }

modify_country_flag.description:
modify country flag. Only modifies if flag already exists.
Example: modify_country_flag = { flag = <name> value = <number> }

modify_state_flag.description:
modify state flag. Only modifies if flag already exists.
Example: modify_state_flag = { flag = <name> value = <number> }

add_state_modifier.description:
Adds a modifier to the state
Example: add_state_modifier = { modifier = { local_non_core_manpower = 0.2 } }

set_province_name.description: set_province_name = { id = <province id> name = <string> } - Set name for a province

set_state_name.description: set_state_name = <string> - Set the current states name

reset_province_name.description: reset name of a province back to localization one.

reset_state_name.description: reset_state_name = yes - Resets the current states name to the original one

set_building_level.description: Sets specific level of a building construction for amount of levels in specified state or province

set_stability.description: Sets the stability to the country in scope. Example: set_stability = 80

add_war_support.description: Adds the war support to the country in scope. Example: add_war_support = 5

set_war_support.description: Sets the war support to the country in scope. Example: set_war_support = 80

random_unit_leader.description: Executes children effects on random unit leader that fulfills the "limit" trigger.

every_unit_leader.description: Executes children effects on unit leaders that fulfills the "limit" trigger. tooltip=key can be added to override tooltip title

random_army_leader.description: Executes children effects on random army leader that fulfills the "limit" trigger.

every_army_leader.description: Executes children effects on army leaders that fulfills the "limit" trigger. tooltip=key can be added to override tooltip title

random_navy_leader.description: Executes children effects on random navy leader that fulfills the "limit" trigger.

every_navy_leader.description: Executes children effects on navy leaders that fulfills the "limit" trigger. tooltip=key can be added to override tooltip title

modify_unit_leader_flag.description:
modify unit leader flag. Only modifies if flag already exists.
Example: _modify_unit_leader_flag_ = { flag = <name> value = <number> }

set_nationality.description:
Set the new country owner for the scoped in unit leader.
Note that this is not related to operative nationalities added via add_nationality.
Note that for operative, this will temporarily lock their slot on the country of origin.

unlock_decision_tooltip.description:
show what decision does
Example: unlock_decision_tooltip = some_decision_here
Example:
unlock_decision_tooltip = {
    decision = <some_decision>
    show_effect_tooltip = yes # default is no
    show_modifiers = yes # default is no
}

add_temporary_buff_to_units.description: Add buffs to units that are belongs to the army group/navy of this unit leader

boost_planning.description: Boost planning of units that are belongs to the army group/navy of this unit leader

add_region_efficiency.description: add efficiency factor to strategic region for from country

global_every_army_leader.description: Executes children effects on army leaders for every country in the world that fulfills the "limit" trigger. Better to use every_army_leader if you know the country. tooltip=key can be added to override tooltip title

clear_variable.description:
Clears a variable
Example: clear_variable = num_dogs

add_attack.description:
Adds attack skill to a unit leader
Example: add_attack = 1

add_defense.description:
Adds defense skill to a unit leader
Example: add_defense = 1

add_planning.description:
Adds planning skill to a unit leader
Example: add_planning = 1

unlock_decision_category_tooltip.description: localizes name of category and displays tooltip that shows it will be unlocked

activate_mission_tooltip.description:
shows mission will activate and name. Activation needs to be handled manually, effect is just an easier way to display name of mission.
Example: unlock_mission_tooltip = some_mission_here

load_focus_tree.description: Sets what focus tree a country uses, retains finished shared focuses.

add_logistics.description:
Adds logistics skill to a unit leader
Example: add_logistics = 1

add_offsite_building.description: Add an offsite building to a country

free_operative.description:
Free an operative
Can be used from a scope and a target that is either a country or a unit leader.
GER = { free_operative = PREV } # where PREV is an operative (unit leader)
free_operative = { captured_by = GER } # where the scope is an unit leader

free_random_operative.description:
Free a random captured operative of a certain tag by a certain tag
Can be used from a country scope of the operative in question.
`all` is optional, default value is no - if set to yes it will free all operatives captured by the target country
GER = { free_random_operative = { all = yes captured_by = ENG } }

add_max_trait.description:
Adds a max assignable trait slot for a general
Example: add_max_trait = 1

add_skill_level.description:
Adds a skill level to a unit leader
Example: add_skill_level = 1

divide_temp_variable.description:
Divies a temp variable to a value or another variable
Example: divide_temp_variable = {
var = num_dogs
	value = 42
	tooltip = loc_str_id_with_LEFT_and_RIGHT  #localized text with LEFT and RIGHT tokens in it, tokens will replaced by values
	if_zero = 0 # the value to assign if the divisor is zero (default is zero)
}

add_timed_unit_leader_trait.description: add a timed trait to unit leader

clamp_variable.description:
Clamps a variable between two values or variables.
Note that either min or max can be omitted.
The order in which the operations are applied is Max( Min( var, max ), min ).
An error will be logged if max < min as the result will be more often than not undesired (requires the game to run in debug mode).
Example: clamp_variable = {
    var = num_dogs
    min = 0
    max = num_cats
}

cancel_border_war.description: cancel border war between two states

set_division_template_lock.description:
Set lock status for a division template
Example: set_division_template_lock = { division_template = <name> is_locked = <bool (default:true)> }

print_variables.description:
prints all variables in scope and temp variables to a file
Example: print_variables = {
file = log_file
text = header_text
append = yes
print_global = yes
var_list = { a b c } #optional
}

activate_mission.description:
Activates mission, ignoring its normal trigger conditions. Cannot activate a mission that is already active. 
Example: activate_mission = some_mission_here

remove_mission.description:
Removes mission without running complete or timeout effects. 
Example: remove_mission = some_mission_here

recall_attache.description: Scope country recalls attache from target country. Example: GER = { recall_attache = CHI } means Germany recalls attache from China.

activate_targeted_decision.description:
Activates targeted decisions or mission, ignoring its normal trigger conditions, cooldown and fire only once. Cannot activate if active in interface. 
Example: activate_targeted_decision = { target = TAG/STATE decision = decision_id_here

remove_targeted_decision.description:
Removes targeted decisions or mission. 
Example: remove_targeted_decision = { target = TAG decision = decision_id_here

modify_timed_idea.description:
Modify amount of days of a timed idea.
 Example: modify_timed_idea = { idea = my_idea_id days = 5 } Adds 5 more days to the idea my_idea_id.

activate_decision.description: Activates specified decision for scope country

set_truce.description:
Sets a truce between scope country and target for days duration. 
Example set_truce = { target = GER days = 90 }

round_variable.description:
Rounds a variable
Example: round_variable = num_dogs

unit_leader_event.description:
Fires a unit leader event for owner country.
Example:
unit_leader_event = {
	id = generic.17 # The event to fire.
	# Optional Fields:
	hours = 12 # The number of hours to wait before firing the event.
	days = 5 # The number of days to wait before firing the event.
	months = 1 # The number of months to wait before firing the event, where a month is treated as 30 days.
		# Note:  hours, days, and months can all be used and will simply be added together.
	random_hours = 18 # A random amount of hours to be added to the delay before firing, from 0 up to but not including random_hours.
	random_days = 2 # A random amount of days to be added to the delay before firing, from 0 up to but one hour less than random_days.
		# Note:  random_hours and random_days can both be used and will simply be added together.
	random = 6 # Equivalent to random_hours; preserverd for backwards compatibility.
	random = { chance = 50 ... } # Specify a set of child effects to execute as part of this effect, with a percentage chance of randomly happening or not (as a group, not individually).
	tooltip = generic.17.t # Manually specify which tooltip to use for this effect.
}

random_operative.description: Executes children effects on a random operatives that fulfills the "limit" trigger.

every_operative.description: Executes children effects on operatives that fulfills the "limit" trigger. tooltip=key can be added to override tooltip title

transfer_units_fraction.description:
Transfer units (air, army, navy) to another country.
Also transfer the stockiled equipment (you can set it to zero if it is undesired) as well as unit leaders.
transfer_units_fraction = {
	target = ROOT          # the recipient
	size = 0.4             # [0,1] Default value for the ratio below if they are not specified
	stockpile_ratio = 0.3  # [0,1] Overrides size modifier for the stockpiled equipment and fuel
	army_ratio = 0.1       # [0,1] Overrides size modifier for army
	navy_ratio = 0.2       # [0,1] Overrides size modifier for navy
	air_ratio = 0.4        # [0,1] Overrides size modifier for air
	keep_unit_leaders = {  # specify IDs of unit leaders that remain with the original country
		700 701
	}
	keep_unit_leaders_trigger = { # Trigger for unit leaders to remain with the original country
		...                         # the scope is the unit leader being evaluated
		...                         # ROOT is the recipient
		...                         # FROM is the sender
		...                         # PREV is unset
	}
}

finalize_border_war.description: finalizes border war between two states, wins or cancels it

remove_decision.description: Remove specified active decision for scope country - Does not run the remove_effect or put the decision on cooldown. Ignores fire_only_once

swap_ruler_traits.description:
swap 2 traits on current ruler. 
 Syntax: swap_ruler_traits = { remove = <trait> add = <trait> }

add_random_trait.description: add random trait from specified list to unit leader. add_random_trait = { old_guard brilliant_strategist inflexible_strategist }

remove_exile_tag.description: remove exile tag from scope unit leader. remove_exile_tag = yes

set_legitimacy.description: set_legitimacy = 10. Sets legitimacy on scope country to specified value. Value has to be 0-100.

become_exiled_in.description: Become exile in target nation. become_exiled_in = { target = TAG legitimacy = 0-100 (optional) }

set_faction_name.description: set_faction_name = NEW_LOC_KEY. Sets the faction name to whatever the new key localises to.

add_maneuver.description:
Adds maneuver skill to a unit leader
Example: add_maneuver = 1

add_coordination.description:
Adds maneuver skill to a unit leader
Example: add_coordination = 1

give_resource_rights.description: Gives rights to take resources from specified state. give_resource_rights = { receiver = <TAG> state = <id> }

remove_resource_rights.description: Remove resource right to state for scope country. remove_resource_rights = ID

inherit_technology.description: Copies over technology state from target

round_temp_variable.description:
Rounds a temporary variable
Example: round_temp_variable = num_dogs

supply_units.description:
Give supply to units being controlled by this leader. 
Example supply_units = 24

set_faction_leader.description: set current country as leader of its faction

set_keyed_oob.description:
Registers an Order of Battle (OOB) file to be loaded for a country at game start, replacing any previously registered OOB (with the given key) on that country.
Only intended to be used within history files.

Example:
set_keyed_oob = {
	key = naval
	name = "ENG_1936_Naval"
}

set_oob.description:
Registers an Order of Battle (OOB) file to be loaded for a country at game start, replacing any previously registered OOB (with no key) on that country.
Only intended to be used within history files.

Example:
set_oob = "ENG_1936"

set_naval_oob.description:
Registers an Order of Battle (OOB) file to be loaded for a country at game start, replacing any previously registered OOB (with key "naval") on that country.
Only intended to be used within history files.

Example:
set_naval_oob = "ENG_1936_Naval"

clear_array.description:
Clears the contents of array
Example: clear_array = array_name

clear_temp_array.description:
Clears the contents of a temporary array
Example: clear_temp_array = array_name

for_each_loop.description:
Runs a loop on for each element of an array
Example: for_each_loop = {
	array = array_name
	value = value_name #optional (default 'v') current value in array will be stored in this temp variable
	index = index_name #optional (default 'i') current index in array will be stored in this temp variable
	break = break_name #optional (default 'break') set this temp variable to non zero to break the loop
 #effect 1
 #effect 2 ...
}

for_each_scope_loop.description:
Runs a loop on for each element of an array and changes scope to current element in each iteration
Example: for_each_scope_loop = {
	array = array_name
	break = break_name #optional (default 'break') set this temp variable to non zero to break the loop
	tooltip = loc #if defined, the effect will output a tooltip for sub effects using this localization as title
 #effect 1
 #effect 2 ...
}

random_scope_in_array.description:
Runs the effect for a random element in array
Example: random_scope_in_array = {
	array = array_name
	limit = { ... trigger ... } a trigger to limit scopes
	break = break_name #optional (default 'break') set this temp variable to non zero to break the loop
 #effect 1
 #effect 2 ...
}

force_update_dynamic_modifier.description:
updates the modifiers in current scope (use if you don't want to wait for daily update to update them):
force_update_dynamic_modifier = yes

for_loop_effect.description:
Runs a same effects through a loop. example will run the effects for value_name = -3, 0, 3, 6, 9 and then terminate
Example: for_loop_effect = {
	start = -3 (default 0) start value of loop
	end = 10 (default 0) end value of loop
	compare_type = less_than_or_equals (default less_than) comparison type between start and end val
	add = 3 (default 1) value to add to current value after each iteration
	value = value_name #optional (default 'v') current value of iteration will be stored in this temp variable
	break = break_name #optional (default 'break') set this temp variable to non zero to break the loop
 #effect 1
 #effect 2 ...
}

while_loop_effect.description:
Runs the effect as long as a trigger is true
Example: while_effect = {
	limit = { ... trigger ... } a trigger to test before each iteration
	break = break_name #optional (default 'break') set this temp variable to non zero to break the loop
 #effect 1
 #effect 2 ...
}

launch_nuke.description:
launch nuke at a state. usage : 
launch_nuke = { 
   provinve = 42 #will nuke this province if specified
   state = 42 #use either province or state. if state is used it will prefer enemies first while picking a province to nuke. otherwise it will pick one of the neutrals
   controller = GER #if state and controller is specified, the effect will pick a province that is controlled by this tag
   use_nuke = yes #will consume nuke if specified
}

scoped_sound_effect.description: Plays sound effect only on in current scope's player

add_mines.description:
Add mines to a strategic region for scoped country.
 add_mines = { region = 42 mines = 100 }

set_fuel_ratio.description: Set country's current fuel ratio relative to its capacity

end_exile.description: Ends the exile of of the current scope's country

kill_ideology_leader.description: removes a ideology leader as leader of his party, making the next in line the new party leader

retire_ideology_leader.description: kills a ideology leader and removes him completely, making the next in line the new party leader

add_resistance.description: add resistance to a state. Example: add_resistance = 30

add_compliance.description: add compliance to a state. Example: add_compliance = 30

start_resistance.description:
starts resistance activity for a core country. 
Use along with force_enable_resistance if you are enabling resistance
in a state that is not possible (ie core).
Example : start_resistance = POL or start_resistance = yes

cancel_resistance.description:
cancels resistance activity for a core country.
use along with force_disable_resistance to disable resistance forever
Example : cancel_resistance = yes

set_resistance.description: set resistance of a state. Example: set_resistance = 30

set_compliance.description: set compliance of a state. Example: set_compliance = 30

steal_random_tech_bonus.description:
adds a random limited use tech bonus from country of categories that is it ahead in compared to you.
it must have atleast one category or folder. But it can contain any number of them in any combination
Note: if a country does not have a tech to be stolen a random tech bonus will be applied based on base_bonus 
Example: steal_random_tech_bonus = {
	category = air_equipment
	folder = naval_folder
	ahead_reduction = ???
	bonus = ???
	base_bonus = 0.05
	instant = yes # instant unlock instead of bonus
	name = ???
	target = ???
	uses = 1
}

every_controlled_state.description: Executes children effects on every controlled state that fulfills the "limit" trigger. tooltip=key can be added to override tooltip title

reserve_dynamic_country.description:
reserves a dynamic country so it won't be recycled for civil wars. A dynamic country with no owned states must be reserved after it is created and unreserved once it is no longer going to be used. example :
reserve_dynamic_country = yes
reserve_dynamic_country = no

random_occupied_country.description: Executes children effects on random occupied country that fulfills the "limit" trigger.

every_occupied_country.description: Executes children effects on every occupied country that fulfills the "limit" trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override tooltip title

add_resistance_target.description:
adds resistance target to the scoped state :
add_resistance_target = 10
add_resistance_target = { 
  id = 123 #if set, id can be used for removing an added resistance target using remove_resistance_target effect  amount = 10 #original tag of new country
  occupied = GER #if set, the resistance target will only apply if the occupied country is GER
  occupier = ENG #if set, the resistance target will only apply if the occupier country is ENG
  days = 42 #if set the newly added resistance target will be only active for this many days
  tooltip = "BLABLA" #tooltip loc key to display in resistance target tooltips
}

remove_resistance_target.description:
removes a previously added resistance target using its id. No tooltips are generated.:
remove_resistance_target = 42

add_decryption.description:
add decryption against a target country. Example:
add_decryption = { 
 target = GER 
 # pick one amount = 1000 # a flat amount to be added
 ratio = 0.3 # a ratio of crypto defense of target to be added

force_enable_resistance.description:
force enables resistance for scoped state. the resistance will be active even if other conditions doesn't satisfy (even if it is core or resistance check trigger is false)  :
force_enable_resistance = GER # same as occupier = GER 
force_enable_resistance = { 
  clear = no #if yes, will clear previously set resistance
  occupier = GER #if set, the resistance will be enabled when the occupier is GER
  occupied = ENG #if set, the resistance will be enabled if the occupier country is target
}

force_disable_resistance.description:
force disables resistance for scoped state.  :
force_disable_resistance = GER # same as occupier = GER 
force_disable_resistance = { 
  clear = no #if yes, will clear previously disabled resistance
  occupier = GER #if set, the resistance will be disabled when the occupier is GER
  occupied = ENG #if set, the resistance will be disabled if the occupier country is target
}

create_intelligence_agency.description: create an Intelligence Agency for the country, if it is not already done.

upgrade_intelligence_agency.description:
add an upgrade to the Intelligence Agency (must be created):
upgrade_intelligence_agency = upgrade_army_department

set_faction_spymaster.description: set current country as spy master of its faction

country_lock_all_division_template.description: Lock all the division template at the country level. Note that you need to unlock them in the same way (You can't use 'set_division_template_lock' individually, because the lock at the country level will not be removed)

harm_operative_leader.description:
Harm an operative. The specified value is subject to modifiers.
harm_operative_leader = 12

force_operative_leader_into_hiding.description:
Force an operative into hiding, preventing him from performing mission. The specified values is subject to modifiers
force_operative_leader_into_hiding = 12

operative_leader_event.description:
Fires a operative leader event for owner country.
Example:
operative_leader_event = {
	id = generic.17 # The event to fire.
	# Optional Fields:
	originator = TAG # The originator of the event (default to the owner of the operative)
	recipient = TAG # The recipient of the event (default to the owner of the operative)
	hours = 12 # The number of hours to wait before firing the event.
	days = 5 # The number of days to wait before firing the event.
	months = 1 # The number of months to wait before firing the event, where a month is treated as 30 days.
		# Note:  hours, days, and months can all be used and will simply be added together.
	random_hours = 18 # A random amount of hours to be added to the delay before firing, from 0 up to but not including random_hours.
	random_days = 2 # A random amount of days to be added to the delay before firing, from 0 up to but one hour less than random_days.
		# Note:  random_hours and random_days can both be used and will simply be added together.
	random = 6 # Equivalent to random_hours; preserverd for backwards compatibility.
	random = { chance = 50 ... } # Specify a set of child effects to execute as part of this effect, with a percentage chance of randomly happening or not (as a group, not individually).
	tooltip = generic.17.t # Manually specify which tooltip to use for this effect.
	set_from = TAG # Set the scope of the From in the scripted localization
	set_from_from = TAG # Set the scope of the From.From in the scripted localization
	set_root = TAG # Set the scope of the Root in the scripted localization
}

random_controlled_state.description:
Executes children effects on random controlled state that fulfills the "limit" trigger. 
prioritize = { <stateID> <stateID> } to pick those states first if they fulfull the limit

mark_focus_tree_layout_dirty.description:
Forces the refresh of the tree layout for the scoped country
mark_focus_tree_layout_dirty = yes

add_civil_war_target.description:
Adds a civil war target to a specific country
 Usage: add_civil_war_target = TAG

execute_operation_coordinated_strike.description: Special effect for executing the Coordinated Strike Operation. amount determines how often the simulation is run

add_nationality.description:
Add the specified nationalty to the scoped-in operative. Examples:
add_nationality = ROOT
add_nationality = FRA

recall_volunteers_from.description:
The scoped in country recall the volunteers sent to the target country.
Example:
# FRA recalls the volunteers it sent to SPR
FRA = { recall_volunteers_from = SPR }

turn_operative.description:
An operative is turned by the specified country.
This transfers the operative to the target country and make it appear as killed to the country of origin (increases the death counter and lock the slot).
This fires the on_action on_operative_death with as killer the target country.
If the target country is the owner of the operative, this has no effect and an error is logged.

WARN: the on_action might execute immediatly, before any effect listed after the occurence of turn_operative.

Examples:
GER = {
    turn_operative = PREV  # where PREV is an operative (unit leader)
    # or
    turn_operative = {
        operative = PREV
    }
}

turn_operative = { turned_by = GER } # where the scope is an unit leader

set_garrison_strength.description: set initial garrison strength. Example: set_garrison_strength = 0.5

if.description:
if_, CIfTrigger, A conditional trigger
if = { limit = { <triggers> } <trigger> }

phase.description: check if we are in this combat phase

and.description: all inside trigger must be true

or.description: at least one entry inside trigger must be true

exists.description: Check if the current country exist. The country of the scope you are in. Example: DEN = { exists = yes }

difficulty.description: check if the difficulty is above or below specified value 0-2 (difficulty enum). Example: difficulty > 0 (above easy)

log.description: Print message to game.log - Can be localized

any_neighbor_country.description: check if any neighbor country meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

has_country_flag.description:
has country flag been set.Check flag val date set and days since set.
Example: has_country_flag = test_flag
has_country_flag = { 
	flag = <name> (mandatory)
	value < <int> (optional)
	date > <date> (optional)
	days > <int> (optional)
}

any_country.description: check if any country meets the trigger

check_variable.description: Compares a variable to a number

is_subject.description: Checks if the country is subject of any other country

threat.description: check the global threat value. 0-1 value

is_capital.description: Is scope state a capital. 169 = { is_capital = yes }

has_global_flag.description:
has global flag been set.Check flag val date set and days since set.
Example: has_global_flag = test_flag
has_global_flag = { 
	flag = <name> (mandatory)
	value < <int> (optional)
	date > <date> (optional)
	days > <int> (optional)
}

is_attacker.description: check if attacker side in combat

has_dlc.description:
Checks if player has a DLC.
Example: has_dlc = "name of the dlc"

hidden_trigger.description: a hidden trigger, anything in it not shown in tooltips

is_female.description: checks if scoped unit leader, ace or country is female

any_enemy_country.description: check if any enemy country meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

is_neighbor_of.description: check if neighbor ( controlled territory ) with specified country

has_opinion.description: check what opinion the country has towards a specified country

has_opinion_modifier.description: check if a country has the opinion modifier

is_subject_of.description: Checks if the country is subject of specified country

all_neighbor_country.description: check if all neighbor countries meet the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

all_country.description: check if all countries meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

all_enemy_country.description: check if all enemy countries meet the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

night.description: check if combat is at night

dig_in.description: check if we have digin level (lowest)

armor.description: Check that average armor level of combatant is over a certain level

is_controlled_by.description: check if state is controlled by

is_owned_by.description: check if state is owned by

has_government.description: does country government (ruling party) belong to ideology group

has_state_flag.description:
has state flag been setCheck flag val date set and days since set.
Example: has_state_flag = test_flag
has_state_flag = { 
	flag = <name> (mandatory)
	value < <int> (optional)
	date > <date> (optional)
	days > <int> (optional)
}

divisions_in_state.description: checks for amount of divisions in specified state owned by current country.

country_exists.description: check if the specified country exist

ships_in_area.description: checks for amount of ships in specified area

has_army_size.description: checks for amount of divisions, additionally of a specified type

has_navy_size.description:
Checks for amount of ships, additionally of a specified type, archetype, or sub unit definition.

Examples:
	has_navy_size = { size > 10 type = convoy } # Must have more than 10 convoys.
	has_navy_size = { size < 1 archetype = ship_hull_light } # Must not have any ships with light hulls.
	has_navy_size = { size > 39 unit = heavy_cruiser } # Must have 40 or more heavy cruisers.
	has_navy_size = { size < 100 } # Must have fewer than 100 ships of any type.

num_of_available_military_factories.description: check amount of available military factories

num_of_available_naval_factories.description: check amount of available naval factories

num_of_available_civilian_factories.description: check amount of available civilian factories

is_in_faction_with.description: check if member of same faction as specified country

is_in_faction.description: check if member of any faction

is_faction_leader.description: check if country leads a faction

is_guaranteed_by.description: check if guaranteed by specified country

has_guaranteed.description: check if country has guaranteed specified country

has_military_access_to.description: check country has military access to specified country

gives_military_access_to.description: check if country gives military access to specified country

any_state.description: check if any state meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

any_owned_state.description: check if any owned state meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

any_neighbor_state.description: check if any neighbor state meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

any_allied_country.description: Check if any allied country meets the trigger. Does not include the country itself. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

all_state.description: check if all states meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

all_owned_state.description: check if all owned states meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

all_neighbor_state.description: check if all neighbor states meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

all_allied_country.description: Check if all allied countries meet the trigger. Does not include the country itself. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

surrender_progress.description: check if a country is close to surrendering

political_power_daily.description:
Checks if daily political power increase is more or less that specified value 
 political_power_daily > 1.5

resistance.description: Compares the current resistance level of a state to a value. Example: resistance > 50

ic_ratio.description: Compares the ratio of total industrial capacity between the scope country and the one set with 'tag'

any_war_score.description: compares the warscore of all wars in a country to see if any fullfills the comparison condition 0-100 - Example: any_war_score > 40

has_idea_with_trait.description: check if country has idea with specified trait

has_deployed_air_force_size.description: checks for amount of aircrafts, additionally of a specified type

is_fighting_in_terrain.description: check what terrain is in combat

is_defender.description: check if defender side in combat

is_winning.description: check if defender side in combat

fastest_unit.description: check if fastest unit of combatant is over this limit

recon_advantage.description: checks if side has an advantage in recon level

is_ironman.description: Check if current game is ironman.

has_start_date.description: Compare the initial start date of current game.

has_available_idea_with_traits.description: Checks if country has more than limit, default = 0.

is_claimed_by.description: Checks if state is claimed by country

is_core_of.description: Checks if state is core of country

is_ai.description: Checks if country is AI controlled.

has_trait.description: check if sides leader has trait

has_reserves.description: check if side has reserves waiting

frontage_full.description: check if sides front is full or can get more reinforcements

free_building_slots.description:
checks building for available construction levels 
free_building_slots = { 
	building = building_type 
	size > 5 
	include_locked = yes 
	province = 42 #will check province buildings if specified 
}

is_demilitarized_zone.description: checks if a state is a demilitarized zone

is_border_conflict.description: checks if a state is in border conflict

has_offensive_war_with.description: One country has offensive war against other country.

has_defensive_war_with.description: One country has defensive war against other country.

casualties.description: Check the amount of casualties a country has suffered in all of it's wars

custom_trigger_tooltip.description: Works as an and-trigger with a custom tooltip. will check if KEY_NOT first if it is inside NOT = { }

has_equipment.description: checks for amount of equipment stored

is_puppet.description: Checks if the country is puppet of any other country

is_puppet_of.description: Checks if the country is puppet of specified country

is_major.description: check if country is a major

is_amphibious_invasion.description: check if combat is at night

strength_ratio.description: Compares the estimated army strength between the scope country and the one set with 'tag'

has_max_planning.description: check if side has maximal planning bonus

has_civil_war.description: check if participant in civil war as revolter or target

less_combat_width_than_opponent.description: check if side has more combat width than their opponent

is_fighting_air_units.description: check if side is fighting air units

has_carrier_airwings_on_mission.description: check if side has a career with air wings on a mission

has_flanked_opponent.description: check if side has flanked their opponent

any_claim.description: check if there is a claim between a country and all others

has_volunteers_amount_from.description: Compares number of volunteers from the country. Example: has_volunteers_amount_from = { tag = ITA count > 1 }

original_tag.description: original tag is ( for civil wars checks )

has_added_tension_amount.description: Compare if the country has added above or below the specified ammount of tension

has_manpower_for_recruit_change_to.description: check if manpower is enough to switch recruitment laws not to be negative

ai_liberate_desire.description: check what liberation desire the country has towards a specified country

can_research.description: check if country can research technology

has_annex_war_goal.description: Checks a country has annex war goal on another country

hardness.description: check lowest/highest hardness level on combatant

has_template_containing_unit.description: check if country has a division template that contains a specific unit

is_in_home_area.description: Checks if the first province in the state is connected to the capital of its owner

state_population.description: check the population in the state

has_war_together_with.description: Are the countries fighting on the same side of a war

has_capitulated.description: checks if the country has capitulated

has_army_manpower.description: checks for amount of manpower of selected type, additionally of a specified type

is_owned_and_controlled_by.description: check if state is owned by

is_tutorial.description: check if the tutorial is active

is_historical_focus_on.description: check if the historical focus is active

original_research_slots.description: check number of research slots at start of game

has_wargoal_against.description:
Checks if country has a wargoal against the target. 
Example: ENG = { has_wargoal_against = GER }

is_justifying_wargoal_against.description:
Checks if country is justifying a wargoal against the target. 
Example: ENG = { is_justifying_wargoal_against = GER }

is_owner_neighbor_of.description: check if neighbor ( owned territory ) with specified country

ai_wants_divisions.description: Will compare towards the amount of divisions an ai wants to have.

has_claimed_state_in_peace_conference.description: Checks if a state has been claimed by target country in an ongoing peace conference

num_owned_neighbour_states.description: Checks if a country owns the amount of states neighbouring the scoped state

num_claimed_peace_conference_neighbour_s.description: Checks if a country owns the amount of states neighbouring the scoped state.

has_elections.description: Checks the country's politics on allowing elections. has_elections = yes

alliance_strength_ratio.description: Compares the estimated army strength between the scope country, his allies and his enemies.

civilwar_target.description: civilwar target is ( for civil wars checks )

is_in_peace_conference.description: Checks if the country is currently in a peaceconference

has_unit_leader.description: check if country has unit leader with specified ID. Don't localize this. Tooltip only for debug.

any_home_area_neighbor_country.description: check if any neighbor country in the home area meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

any_other_country.description: check if any other country meets the trigger. Excludes current country. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

all_other_country.description: check if all other countries meets the trigger. Excludes current country. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

has_non_aggression_pact_with.description: Check if country has non aggression pact with the specified country

num_faction_members.description:
Compares the number of members in the faction for the current country. 
 Example: num_faction_members > 10

enemies_strength_ratio.description: Compares the estimated army strength between the scope country and all its enemies

has_custom_difficulty_setting.description:
Returns true if the game has the specified custom difficulty on: 
Example: has_custom_difficulty_setting = TheAxisIndustry

has_any_custom_difficulty_setting.description: Returns true if the game has any custom difficulty on

has_country_custom_difficulty_setting.description: Returns true if the game has any custom difficulty on the scope nation

is_researching_technology.description:
Checks if the country is currently researching a specific technology.
Example: is_researching_technology = mechanised_infantry

is_in_tech_sharing_group.description:
Checks if country is member specified technology sharing group.
Example: is_in_technology_sharing_group = commonwealth_research

has_autonomy_state.description:
check if country currently has an autonomy state, example:
has_autonomy_state = puppet

compare_autonomy_progress_ratio.description:
check if autonomy progress ratio is higher than value, example:
compare_autonomy_progress_ratio > 0.5

compare_autonomy_state.description:
check if autonomy state is higher than other one, example:
compare_autonomy_state > puppet

has_cosmetic_tag.description:
Checks if country has specific cosmetic tag set.
Example: INS = { has_cosmetic_tag = INS1 }

num_subjects.description: check the number of subjects of nation

num_tech_sharing_groups.description: checks how many groups a nation is a member of

has_template.description: Check if country has a division template of specific name

has_state_category.description: Check if state has a specific state category

has_cavalry_ratio.description: Check that ratio of cavalry brigades in the composition of a side of combating troops are over a certain level

num_occupied_states.description: check the number of states occupied by nation

has_damaged_buildings.description: check for damaged buildings of nation

has_resources_amount.description:
checks for amount of resources in specified state
Example:
has_resources_amount = {
	resource = chromium
	amount > 10
	delivered = no #check the delivered amount, where all modifiers apply
	state = 31 (optional - can be used in state scope instead)

has_template_majority_unit.description: check if country has a division template that is majority of specific unit

min_planning.description: check if side has maximal planning bonus

has_army_experience.description:
Compares current country's army experience with right side value.
 has_army_experience < <value>

has_air_experience.description:
Compares current country's air experience with right side value.
 has_air_experience < <value>

has_navy_experience.description:
Compares current country's navy experience with right side value.
 has_navy_experience < <value>

num_divisions.description: Will compare towards the amount of divisions a country has control over, if strength matters use has_army_size.

count_triggers.description:
Returns true if the specified number of sub-triggers return true
count_triggers = { amount = 2 <trigger> <trigger> <trigger> }

is_target_of_coup.description: is_target_of_coup = yes - Returns true if current country is being targeted by a coup from any country.

is_staging_coup.description: is_staging_coup = yes - Returns true if current country is staging a coup in another any country.

has_focus_tree.description: Does current country have the specified focus tree.

has_template_ai_majority_unit.description: check if country has a division template that is majority of specific unit using AI's priorities rather than visual

has_any_license.description:
Country has any active licenses
Example: has_any_license = yes

is_licensing_any_to.description:
Current country is licensing something to target country
Example: is_licensing_any_to = ENG

ai_has_role_template.description: check if the ai controlled country has any template for a specific role

ai_has_role_division.description: check if the ai controlled country has any fielded divisions for a specific role

any_province_building_level.description: In the current state, checks if any province within the specified limit has a building of the specified level.

estimated_intel_max_armor.description: Compares estimated max armor based on intel. Example: estimated_intel_max_armor = { tag = ITA value > 1 }

estimated_intel_max_piercing.description: Compares estimated max armor based on intel. Example: estimated_intel_max_piercing = { tag = ITA value > 1 }

amount_research_slots.description:
check number of research current research slots 
 amount_research_slots > 2

manpower_per_military_factory.description:
Number of available manpower per factory the country has. Excluding dockyards.
manpower_per_military_factory < 1000

amount_taken_ideas.description:
has current country picked specified amount of ideas. Category and slot is optional.
Excludes national_spirit, hidden, law = yes
amount_taken_ideas = {
	amount < <int> (mandatory)
	category = { military_staff } (optional)
	slot = { army_chief political_advisor } (optional)
}

has_carrier_airwings_in_own_combat.description: Check if carrier has airplanes that are part of the current combat

enemies_naval_strength_ratio.description: Compares the estimated navy strength between the scope country and all its enemies

alliance_naval_strength_ratio.description: Compares the estimated naval strength between the scope country, his allies and his enemies.

has_stability.description: check value of stability 0-1: Example has_stability < 0.6

has_war_support.description: check value of war_support 0-1: Example has_war_support < 0.6

all_unit_leader.description: check if all unit leaders meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

any_unit_leader.description: check if any unit leader meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

all_army_leader.description: check if all unit leaders meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

any_army_leader.description: check if any unit leader meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

all_navy_leader.description: check if all unit leaders meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

any_navy_leader.description: check if any unit leader meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

is_assigned.description: is_assigned = yes/no - Checks if the current unit leader is assigned to command an army/navy

num_units.description:
Check number of units commanded by the unit leader 
 num_units > 2

is_field_marshal.description: is_field_marshal = yes/no - Checks if the current unit leader is a field marshall

has_unit_leader_flag.description:
has unit leader flag been setCheck flag val date set and days since set.
Example: has_unit_leader_flag = test_flag
has_unit_leader_flag = { 
	flag = <name> (mandatory)
	value < <int> (optional)
	date > <date> (optional)
	days > <int> (optional)
}

has_decision.description: check if country has active selected decision

command_power.description:
Checks if available command power is more or less that specified value 
 command_power > 1.5

command_power_daily.description:
Checks if daily command power increase is more or less that specified value 
 command_power_daily > 1.5

is_fully_controlled_by.description: Checks if state is fully controlled by specified tag

has_ability.description:
does unit leader have the abilityCheck if a unit leader has the ability.
Example: has_ability = force_attack

has_variable.description: Checks if a variable exists in a scope

has_id.description: check unit leader has specified ID. Don't localize this. Tooltip only for debug.

can_select_trait.description: check if leader can select a trait

has_captured_operative.description:
Checks if a country has a captured an operative ( supports scoped variables )
has_captured_operative = GER/yes/no

clamp_temp_variable.description: clamps a temp variable between two values/variables

num_of_civilian_factories_available_for_.description: check amount of civilian factories available for a new project to use

has_event_target.description: checks if current scope or global scope has the specified event target saved

political_power_growth.description: Check the value of political power daily growth.Exacmple: political_power_growth > 0

has_border_war.description: Checks if a there is any border wars for country/state

is_border_war.description: Checks if a the combatant or leader has a border war

has_border_war_between.description: Checks if a there is a border war between two states

has_border_war_with.description: Checks if a there is a border against a state/country

average_stats.description:
Compares the average stats for a unit leader.
Example: average_stats > 10

attack_skill_level.description:
Compares attack skill level of a unit leader.
Example: attack_skill_level > 5

defense_skill_level.description:
Compares defense skill level of a unit leader.
Example: defense_skill_level > 5

logistics_skill_level.description:
Compares logistics skill level of a unit leader.
Example: logistics_skill_level > 5

planning_skill_level.description:
Compares planning skill level of a unit leader.
Example: planning_skill_level > 5

is_leading_army_group.description: is_leading_army_group = yes/no - Checks if the current unit leader is leading an army group (not single army)

is_leading_army.description: is_leading_army = yes/no - Checks if the current unit leader is leading a single army (not army group)

print_variables.description:
prints all variables in scope and temp variables to a file
Example: print_variables = {
file = log_file
text = header_text
append = yes
print_global = yes
var_list = { a b c } #optional
}

has_active_mission.description: check if country has an active mission with specified ID. has_active_mission = my_test_mission

has_attache.description: Has attach from any other country

amount_manpower_in_deployment_queue.description: Checks for amount manpower currently in deploymentview. amount_manpower_in_training > 10

army_manpower_in_state.description:
Checks for amount manpower currently the target state with option to specify a type.
Example:
army_manpower_in_state = {
	state = <id> (variables supported)
	amount < <int> (variables supported)
	type > <equipment_type> (armor, infantry, etc.)

is_exiled_leader.description: Checks if scope leader is from an exiled government. is_exiled_leader = yes

is_exiled_in.description: Checks if scope country is a government in exile in target tag. is_exiled_in = ENG

is_hosting_exile.description: Checks if scope country is hosting target tag as an exile. is_hosting_exile = FRA

is_exiled_leader_from.description: Checks if scope leader is from specified exiled government. is_exiled_leader_from = FRA

is_exile_host.description: Checks if scope country is hosting an exile. is_exile_host = yes

is_government_in_exile.description: Checks if scope country an exiled government. is_government_in_exile = yes

divisions_in_border_state.description: checks for amount of divisions in specified state owned by current country.

stockpile_ratio.description: Compares the ratio of equipment archetype in stockpile vs used. a value of 2 means we have double in stockpile of what is fielded or in training.

round_temp_variable.description:
Rounds a temporary variable
Example: round_temp_variable = num_dogs

has_subject.description: Checks if the country has for subject the given country

game_rules_allow_achievements.description: Returns true if all of the active game rule options allow achievements.

clear_temp_array.description:
Clears the contents of a temporary array
Example: clear_temp_array = array_name

any_of.description:
Runs a loop on an array and check a trigger for each value, if any true returns true. otherwise returns false
Example: any_of = {
	array = array_name
	value = value_name #optional (default 'value') current value in array will be stored in this temp variable
	index = index_name #optional (default 'index') current index in array will be stored in this temp variable
 #trigger 1
 #trigger 2 ...
}

all_of.description:
Runs a loop on an array and check a trigger for each value, if any false returns false. otherwise returns true
Example: all_of = {
	array = array_name
	value = value_name #optional (default 'v') current value in array will be stored in this temp variable
	index = index_name #optional (default 'i') current index in array will be stored in this temp variable
 #trigger 1
 #trigger 2 ...
}

has_fuel.description:
check amount of fuel
example:
has_fuel > 500

all_of_scopes.description:
Runs a loop on an array and check a trigger for each scope in it, if any false returns false. otherwise returns true
Example: all_of_scopes = {
	array = array_name
	tooltip = loc #if defined the trigger will output tooltip using this title
 #trigger 1
 #trigger 2 ...
}

has_country_leader_with_trait.description:
check if current country has specified trait.
has_country_leader_with_trait = big_fat_idiot

has_legitimacy.description: Check scope country legitimacy 0-100: Example has_legitimacy < 60

has_rule.description:
Checks if a rule set for a country.
Example: has_rule = can_puppet

state_population_k.description: check the population in the state in thousands (use to avoid variable overflows)

casualties_k.description: Check the amount of casualties in thousands a country has suffered in all of it's wars

fuel_ratio.description:
Compares the fuel ratio to a variable.
Example: fuel_ratio > 0.5

days_since_last_strategic_bombing.description:
Checks the days since last strategic bombing.
days_since_last_strategic_bombing < 10

days_since_capitulated.description:
Checks the number of days since the country last capitulated, even if it is no longer capitulated.
	If it has not ever capitulated, the value is extremely large.
	It is recommended to combine this with has_capitulated = yes when you specifically want to ignore non-active capitulations.
Examples:
	HOL = { has_capitulated = yes days_since_capitulated > 60 } # The Netherlands has been capitulated for more than two months
	FRA = { has_capitulated = yes days_since_capitulated < 21 } # France has capitulated sometime within the past three weeks
	GER = { OR = { has_capitulated = no days_since_capitulated > 14 } } # Germany is not both actively and recently capitulated

mine_threat.description: A trigger to check how dangerous enemy mines are for a country. Controlled by NAVAL_MINE_DANGER defines. Returns a value between 0 and 1. Example mine_threat > 0.5

convoy_threat.description: A trigger to check convoy threat for a country. Controlled by NAVAL_CONVOY_DANGER defines. Returns a value between 0 and 1. Example convoy_threat > 0.5

is_fighting_in_weather.description:
Checks the weather on a combat
Example:
# true if weather is artic water
is_fighting_in_weather = artic_water
# true if weather is either artic_water or snow
is_fighting_in_weather = { artic_water snow }

compliance.description: Compares the current compliance level of a state to a value. Example: compliance > 50

compliance_speed.description: Compares the current compliance speed of a state to a value. Example: compliance_speed > 50

resistance_speed.description: Compares the current resistance speed of a state to a value. Example: resistance_speed > 50

occupied_country_tag.description: compares occupied country that creates resistance to a tag. Example: occupied_country_tag = ITA

resistance_target.description: Compares the target resistance level of a state to a value. Example: resistance_target > 50

has_resistance.description: returns true if state has a resistance

has_active_resistance.description: returns true if state has an active resistance (above zero)

has_occupation_modifier.description: compares occupied country that creates resistance to a tag. Example: has_occupation_modifier = modifier_name

is_debug.description: returns true if game is in debug mode (launched with -debug argument)

occupation_law.description: checks occupation law of state. Example: occupation_law = brutally_oppressive_occupation

is_ally_with.description:
checks if a country is ally with another country. will check if two countries are same/in same faction/has subject master relation
Example: is_ally_with = ITA

any_occupied_country.description: check if any any occupied meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

all_occupied_country.description: check if all occupied countries meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

has_done_agency_upgrade.description: has country done this intelligence agency upgrade (to its highest level)

has_intelligence_agency.description: has country created an Intelligence Agency

is_spymaster.description: check if country is Spy Master

foreign_manpower.description: check the amount of foreign garrison manpower we have

garrison_manpower_need.description: check the amount of manpower needed by garrisons

agency_upgrade_number.description:
Checks the number of upgrade done in the intelligence agency. 
agency_upgrade_number > 4

operative_leader_mission.description:
Checks whether the operative is performing the given mission:
operative_leader_mission = build_intel_network

all_operative_leader.description: check if all operatives meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

any_operative_leader.description: check if any operatives meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

is_operative_captured.description: Checks whether the operative has the matching captured status

intel_level_over.description:
Compare the absolute, percentage based, intel level the scoped country has over
the specified one:
GER = {
  # is true if all predicates are satisfied
  intel_level_over = { 
    target = POL
    civilian_intel > 0.5  # GER has more than 50% civ. intel over POL
    army_intel = 0  # GER has no army intel over POL
    navy_intel > 0  # GER has at least some navy intel over POL
    # airforce_intel is not specified and thus ignored in the comparison

    # NOTE: since we are comparing the intel level of a country over another,
    # checking for values less than 0 does not make sense
    # NOTE: since we are comparing percentages, using values greater than 1
    # does not make sense.
  }
}

any_controlled_state.description: check if any of the states controlled by the scope country meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

all_controlled_state.description: check if all of the states controlled by the scope country meets the trigger. tooltip=key can be defined to override title

num_of_operatives.description: Checks the number of operatives the country controls

num_operative_slots.description:
Checks the number of available operative slots a country has.
If this differs from the number of operative, this does not mean the country can recruit an operative, but that it will eventually be able to.

num_free_operative_slots.description:
Checks the number of operative a country can recruit right now.
Note that this is not necessarily greater than zero if num_operative_slots returned a number greater than the number of operative.

is_cryptology_department_active.description: has country an active cryptology department

is_decrypting.description: checks if is currently decrypting a cipher. Example is_decrypting = GER

is_fully_decrypted.description: checks if fully decrypted a cipher. Example is_fully_decrypted = GER

is_active_decryption_bonuses_enabled.description: checks if the country activated their active cipher decryption bonuses. Example is_active_decryption_bonuses_enabled = GER

num_fake_intel_divisions.description: Will compare towards the amount of fake intel divisions a country has control over. .

conscription_ratio.description: Checks  conscription ratio of the country compared to target conscription ratio.

target_conscription_amount.description: Checks the target conscription amount of the country.

current_conscription_amount.description: Checks the current conscription amount of the country.

operative_leader_operation.description:
Checks whether the operative is performing the given operation:
operative_leader_operation = operation_rescue_operative

can_declare_war_on.description: checks if the country could potentially declare a war on the target ( according to game rules, relationship, etc... ). Example can_declare_war_on = GER

has_nationality.description:
Checks whether the operative has the specified nationality.
NOTE: this is invalid on non-operatives.
Examples:
has_nationality = GER
